attributes.action: Change the legal working age to 15 years old instead of 16.
attributes.additional_details: First and foremost, reducing the minimum working age to 15 can significantly contribute to the development and future prospects of our youth. By allowing 15-year-olds to gain employment experience, we empower them with valuable skills and knowledge that can complement their formal education. This early exposure to the workforce can foster a sense of responsibility, improve time management, enhance problem-solving abilities, and boost communication skills.
attributes.background: Lowering the minimum working age in the UK to 15 is a topic that warrants careful consideration. Advocates of this change argue that it could bring several benefits, while opponents express concerns about its potential drawbacks.

rejection.details:
From the age of 13 children can work part-time. You can find out about the rules relating to child employment here: https://www.gov.uk/child-employment

We could accept a petition calling for changes to the rules on child employment, or changes to the school leaving age, if you want children to be able to leave school early to work.
